page.title: 14Dr.Cooper from Insch contd..
page.content: And so he started in general practice in the slums of London. As a young man he caught "Consumption", a disease better known today as Tuberculosis.In 1912 he was taken on as a partner and stayed until he retired when he was seventy eight years old. Dr. Cooper was one of the seven doctors who helped in the setting up of the National Health Service. Sometimes instead of money as payment for his services he was paid in kind. We saw a picture in silk of lions which he got from a man as payment. He used to smoke but he gave it up a long time ago because he realised it was bad for his health.He doesn't drink either.He says he has lived so long because he has had nothing to do with women! His family told us he has no worries and is a very contented old man.
